DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Lipase Outcome Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether the outcome from a laboratory procedure to measure lipase met the pre-determined criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for lipase, an enzyme secreted in the digestive tract that catalyzes the breakdown of fats into individual fatty acids that can be absorbed into the bloodstream.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Lipase; an enzyme secreted in the digestive tract that catalyzes the breakdown of fats into individual fatty acids that can be absorbed into the bloodstream.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Lipase; an enzyme secreted in the digestive tract that catalyzes the breakdown of fats into individual fatty acids that can be absorbed into the bloodstream.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study lipase less than
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study lipase less than 2.0 x upper limit of normal and there is no radiologic evidence of pancreatitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study amylase and lipase less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal within any symptoms of pancreatitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study lipase and amylase less than 2.0 x upper limit of normal and there is no radiologic evidence of pancreatitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study lipase and amylase less than or equal to 2.0 x upper limit of normal and there is no radiologic evidence of pancreatitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study amylase and lipase less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal without any symptoms of pancreatitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study lipase less than or equal to 2 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study lipase less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal, within 7 days prior to starting treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study lipase less than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study lipase less than 2.0 x upper limit of normal and there is no radiologic or clinical evidence of pancreatitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is serum lipase less than or equal to ULN at screening?
